abstract: Despite regulations and legal settlements, investors seem to believe the future of cigarettes is brighter than ever.
snippet: Despite regulations and legal settlements, investors seem to believe the future of cigarettes is brighter than ever.
lead_paragraph: There are plenty of reasons cigarettes would seem to be a terrible business.

headline.main: Wall Street Finds a Lot to Like About Tobacco
headline.print_headline: Stigma Aside, Wall St. Finds A Lot to Like About Tobacco

abstract: In what at first glance may seem counterintuitive, Wall Street’s enthusiasm for Altria‘s plans to spin off its Kraft Foods unit is not because Kraft, the world’s second-largest food company, will finally shed the taint of tobacco, but rather that the tobacco giant will finally be rid of Kraft. Altria is expected to announce a timetable for the spinoff on Wednesday. After cutting Kraft loose, Altria may step up the pace of its tobacco-related takeovers, analysts told Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: In what at first glance may seem counterintuitive, Wall Street’s enthusiasm for Altria‘s plans to spin off its Kraft Foods unit is not because Kraft, the world’s second-largest food company, will finally shed the taint of tobacco, but rather that the tobacco giant will finally be rid of Kraft. Altria is expected to announce a timetable for the spinoff on Wednesday. After cutting Kraft loose, Altria may step up the pace of its tobacco-related takeovers, analysts told Bloomberg News.
